label: Streptococcal pharyngitis
description: Bacterial infection of the pharynx caused by group A Streptococcus

label: Viral pharyngitis
description: Viral infection of the pharynx, most commonly caused by rhinovirus, adenovirus, or coronavirus

label: Infectious mononucleosis
description: Viral infection caused by Epstein-Barr virus, characterized by fever, fatigue, and pharyngitis

label: Viral gastroenteritis
description: Viral infection of the gastrointestinal tract causing diarrhea, vomiting, and cramping

label: Acute appendicitis
description: Inflammation of the vermiform appendix requiring urgent surgical evaluation

label: Peptic ulcer disease
description: Ulceration of gastric or duodenal mucosa, often associated with H. pylori or NSAIDs

lrTable.note: H. pylori strongly associated with PUD

label: Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD)
description: Chronic acid reflux causing symptoms and/or mucosal damage

label: Acute cholecystitis
description: Acute inflammation of the gallbladder, usually due to gallstone impaction

label: Biliary colic
description: Intermittent pain due to gallstone obstruction without inflammation

lrTable.note: Postprandial RUQ pain classic for biliary colic

label: Acute pancreatitis
description: Acute inflammation of the pancreas, commonly due to gallstones or alcohol

label: Diverticulitis
description: Inflammation of colonic diverticula, typically affecting sigmoid colon

label: Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS)
description: Functional bowel disorder with abdominal pain and altered bowel habits

lrTable.note: Absence of alarm symptoms supports IBS

label: Crohn's disease
description: Chronic inflammatory bowel disease affecting any part of GI tract

lrTable.note: Perianal disease highly specific for Crohn's

label: Ulcerative colitis
description: Chronic inflammatory bowel disease limited to colon and rectum

label: Celiac disease
description: Autoimmune disorder triggered by gluten ingestion causing small bowel inflammation

label: Acute bacterial sinusitis
description: Bacterial infection of paranasal sinuses, typically following viral upper respiratory infection

label: Allergic rhinitis
description: IgE-mediated inflammatory response to environmental allergens affecting nasal mucosa

label: Laryngitis
description: Inflammation of the larynx causing hoarseness, typically viral in origin

lrTable.note: Complete voice loss in severe cases

label: Influenza
description: Viral respiratory infection caused by influenza A or B virus

label: COVID-19
description: Respiratory illness caused by SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus

label: Peritonsillar abscess
description: Collection of pus in peritonsillar space, serious complication of tonsillitis

label: Epiglottitis
description: Acute inflammation of epiglottis, potentially life-threatening airway emergency

lrTable.note: Drooling due to inability to swallow
Voice changes due to supraglottic swelling

label: Rheumatoid arthritis
description: Chronic autoimmune inflammatory arthritis affecting multiple joints symmetrically

label: Systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)
description: Multi-system autoimmune disease with variable organ involvement

lrTable.note: ANA positive in >95% of SLE cases

label: Ankylosing spondylitis
description: Chronic inflammatory arthritis primarily affecting axial skeleton

lrTable.note: HLA-B27 positive in 90% of AS cases

label: Psoriatic arthritis
description: Inflammatory arthritis associated with psoriasis affecting joints and entheses

label: Sjgren's syndrome
description: Autoimmune disease primarily affecting salivary and lacrimal glands

label: Hashimoto's thyroiditis
description: Autoimmune thyroid disease causing hypothyroidism
